p: Calophyllum brasiliense ( C. brasiliense) is a medicinal plant, and basically belongs to the family of Clusiaceae, mostly found in South America, Central America and the Caribbean region [ 218]. It is used as a remedy to treat several diseases, such as parasitic, viral, bacterial and fungal diseases [ 218, 220]. Its potent biological activities include antiviral, antibacterial, anti-protozoal and antifungal effects [ 218, 219]. However, Kudo et al., 2013 investigated the role of this medicinal plant in HIV disease, firstly by extracting tricyclic coumarin from the leaves of C. brasiliense and testing in vitro [ 220]. Hence, they revealed that tricyclic coumarin from C. Brasiliense possesses great potential to inhibit viral replication by blocking the NFkB pathway [ 220].
